newsitem.title: USA: Seagate sees Q4 results below expectations.
newsitem.headline: Seagate sees Q4 results below expectations.

text.p: Seagate Technology Inc on Monday said it expected its fourth-quarter results to come in lower than expected because of weak demand for its high-performance computer disk drive products.
Analysts had expected the company to earn $1.06 a share in its fiscal fourth quarter, according to a First Call survey.
The company said in a statement said earnings before any charges could fall short of its profits of $1.01 per share for the third quarter ended March.
Its gross margin in the fourth quarter is expected to be steady with the margin in the previous three months.
The company said revenues for the fourth quarter, ending June 27, were expected to be between six and 10 percent less than the $2.5 billion of revenues reported in its third quarter.
Seagate said the long-term outlook for the storage business remains strong.
Shares of the Scotts Valley, California-based company have been under pressure in recent days amid concerns about possible oversupply in the global disk-drive market.

A Singapore paper, Business Times, reported last week that Seagate may have to cut its high-end output in Singapore and that May and June production could drop as much as 30 percent from March levels.

Seagate also said it would seek authorization from its board of directors to repurchase up to $600 million more of its stock. That is in addition to the almost $570 million of its stock already purchased during the current fiscal year. At the end of its third quarter, Seagate had about 255.3 million shares outstanding.
Shares of Seagate closed 1-3/4 higher at 42-3/8 on Monday.
